channel.title: Game Jam on Harry Ingham - Portfolio
channel.description: Recent content in Game Jam on Harry Ingham - Portfolio

item.title: F!#&CK Around And Find (your way) Out
item.description:
Stuck in a deadly maze with a friend stuck in a locked control room, you must communicate in order to escape. The unlabelled buttons in the control room could open doors vital for your escape or activate deadly traps that will certainly spell your doom. The only way to know for sure is to f!#&ck around and find (your way) out. A 2-player networked multiplayer game for Nintendo DS, PC and VR!

When we came up with the concept for this game, with one person locked in a control room whilst the other navigates a deadly maze, I pitched the idea of the control panel being on a Nintendo DS instead of on PC, and the person navigating the maze using a VR headset. The image of two people playing a game together where one person was in VR and the other on a DS was enough to sell the team on the idea. The DS is a console I have very fond memories of, and I had been playing around with ideas for a homebrew DS game for a few months, and this was a great excuse to finally make it.

item.title: Vanishing Act
item.description:
Playing as a witch stuck in your mansion as it is being raided by a demonic entity, gather the ingredients to perform a ritual to escape. Made by myself and a few friends for the AGDS Freshers Jam 2024.

I developed the event-based interaction and highlight system for interacting with the various puzzle elements of the game. I was also responsible for creating the character controller and ensuring the camera provides an adequate view of the scene without clipping through any walls.

I was also responsible for creating the quest system used to track the player’s progress in the ritual, ensuring the player had to perform the ritual steps in the correct order, and updating the displayed elements on the ritual table as appropriate.

Vanishing Act was my first project developed in Unreal Engine, and was programmed in C++.

Vanishing Act - Itch.io

Vanishing Act - Github

item.title: MasqueRAID
item.description:
Sneak in to the Museum of Masks to steal the GOLDEN MASK by utilising the masks on display to gain new abilities and evade detection by the museum’s security systems.

I was responsible for programming the various abilities of the mask, including teleportation, cloning the player, and allowing them to double jump.

I also created the tooltips that display the current mask’s controls to the player, helping them to quickly figure out their new abilities.

MasqueRAID was created in the Unity Engine, and was programmed in C#.

MasqueRAID - Global Game Jam

MasqueRAID - Github

item.title: Fishyphus
item.description:
A small game made by myself and a few friends for the 2 day long AGDS Halloween Jam 2024 made in the Unreal 5 Engine. Playing as the witch from Vanishing Act, and having successfully escaped the feds to your lakeside retreat, you are now on an eternal fishing holiday. My main contributions to this project were the bobbing of the fishing bobber, and the logic for when the player can catch a fish.

Since the mechanics of the game were quite simple, we were able to spend a lot of time coming up with the various junk items the player could fish up and fill their cauldron with. It was a fun opportunity to put a lot of inside jokes from our friend group, along with references to popular memes of the time, into a game in such a way that would only be entertaining to ourselves.

Fishyphus was created in Unreal Engine 5, and programmed using C++ and Unreal Blueprint Visual Scripting.

Fishyphus - Itch.io

Fishyphus - Github

item.title: Bubble Bunny Bout
item.description:
An extremely realistic depiction of two bunnies made of bubbles having a bout! A 2-player party game where you and your friend must duel to the death as bunnies made of bubbles using your controller joysticks to control your sword and shield arms.

I was responsible for handling the way points are awarded, along with scene transitions and the creation of the victory screen.

Bubble Bunny Bout was a group project created in 48 hours as part of Global Game Jam 2025 and was programmed in C++ using Unreal Engine.

Bubble Bunny Bout - Global Game Jam Page

Bubble Bunny Bout - Github
